text: {{Infobox writer |name = Patrick Modiano |image = Patrick Modiano 6 dec 2014 - 22.jpg |caption = Modiano in Stockholm during the Swedish Academy's press conference, Dec 2014 |birth_name = Jean Patrick Modiano |birth_date = |birth_place = Boulogne-Billancourt, France |death_date = |death_place = |resting_place= |occupation = Novelist |language = French |nationality = France |education = |alma_mater = |period = |genre = Novels |spouse = Dominique Zehrfuss |children = Zina Modiano Marie Modiano |relatives = |awards = Grand Prix du roman de l'Académie française (1972) Prix Goncourt (1978) Prix mondial Cino Del Duca (2010) Austrian State Prize for European Literature (2012) Nobel Prize in Literature (2014) }} Jean Patrick Modiano (; born 30 July 1945), generally known as Patrick Modiano, is a French novelist. He won the 2014 Nobel Prize in Literature. He is known for Rue des boutiques obscures. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:French novelists Category:Writers from Boulogne-Billancourt
title: Patrick Modiano
